message_1: Consider the trefoil knot, which is a knot in the shape of a three-leaf clover. Suppose we want to calculate the crossing number of the trefoil knot. How many times does the knot cross itself?
message_2: The crossing number of a knot is the minimum number of times the knot crosses itself in any diagram representing the knot. For the trefoil knot, the crossing number is 3. This means that in any diagram representing the trefoil knot, it will cross itself at least 3 times.
